trans-unit.source: The query operation returns items from a table.
trans-unit.target: The query operation returns items from a table.

trans-unit.source: By default, Mobile Services returns only 50 records in a query.
trans-unit.target: By default, Mobile Services returns only 50 records in a query.

trans-unit.source: Use paging in the request to return more.
trans-unit.target: Use paging in the request to return more.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>Add paging to your queries</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/mobile-services-html-how-to-use-client-library/#paging</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>Add paging to your queries</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/mobile-services-html-how-to-use-client-library/#paging</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The request may be specified as follows.
trans-unit.target: The request may be specified as follows.

trans-unit.source: Replace <parameterReference>%%amp;lt;service_name%%amp;gt;</parameterReference> with your mobile service name and <parameterReference>%%amp;lt;table_name%%amp;gt;</parameterReference> with the name of the table to access.
trans-unit.target: Replace <parameterReference>%%amp;lt;service_name%%amp;gt;</parameterReference> with your mobile service name and <parameterReference>%%amp;lt;table_name%%amp;gt;</parameterReference> with the name of the table to access.

trans-unit.source: <token>firstref_zumo</token> supports the following subset of the query option parameters defined by the Open Data Protocol (OData).
trans-unit.target: <token>firstref_zumo</token> supports the following subset of the query option parameters defined by the Open Data Protocol (OData).

trans-unit.source: Restricts returned items based on a filter predicate.
trans-unit.target: Restricts returned items based on a filter predicate.

trans-unit.source: Returns a count of all items that could be returned in the base query without paging applied.
trans-unit.target: Returns a count of all items that could be returned in the base query without paging applied.

trans-unit.source: You must specify a value of <languageKeyword>allpages</languageKeyword> for this parameter.
trans-unit.target: You must specify a value of <languageKeyword>allpages</languageKeyword> for this parameter.

trans-unit.source: Orders the returned items by one or more columns.
trans-unit.target: Orders the returned items by one or more columns.

trans-unit.source: Ordering can be specified as ascending (<languageKeyword>asc</languageKeyword>), which is the default, or descending (<languageKeyword>desc</languageKeyword>)
trans-unit.target: Ordering can be specified as ascending (<languageKeyword>asc</languageKeyword>), which is the default, or descending (<languageKeyword>desc</languageKeyword>)

trans-unit.source: Defines a new projection of data by specifying the columns included in the returned data.
trans-unit.target: Defines a new projection of data by specifying the columns included in the returned data.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the number of records from the base query to skip before returning items.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the number of records from the base query to skip before returning items.

trans-unit.source: This is used for paging results.
trans-unit.target: This is used for paging results.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>Add paging to your queries</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/mobile-services-html-how-to-use-client-library/#paging</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>Add paging to your queries</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/mobile-services-html-how-to-use-client-library/#paging</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the number of items to include in response.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the number of items to include in response.

trans-unit.source: This is used for paging results.
trans-unit.target: This is used for paging results.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>Add paging to your queries</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/mobile-services-html-how-to-use-client-library/#paging</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>Add paging to your queries</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/mobile-services-html-how-to-use-client-library/#paging</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: When a value of <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword> is supplied, the execution of registered scripts is suppressed.
trans-unit.target: When a value of <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword> is supplied, the execution of registered scripts is suppressed.

trans-unit.source: To suppress script execution, you must also supply the service master key in the <languageKeyword>X-ZUMO-MASTER</languageKeyword> header.
trans-unit.target: To suppress script execution, you must also supply the service master key in the <languageKeyword>X-ZUMO-MASTER</languageKeyword> header.

trans-unit.source: When a value of <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword> is supplied with a table that has soft delete enabled, rows with the <languageKeyword>__deleted</languageKeyword> system property set to true will be included in the response.
trans-unit.target: When a value of <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword> is supplied with a table that has soft delete enabled, rows with the <languageKeyword>__deleted</languageKeyword> system property set to true will be included in the response.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, those rows will not be returned when soft delete is enabled.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, those rows will not be returned when soft delete is enabled.

trans-unit.source: A comma delimited list of the system properties to be includes in the response.
trans-unit.target: A comma delimited list of the system properties to be includes in the response.

trans-unit.source: System properties from the following list are accepted:
trans-unit.target: System properties from the following list are accepted:

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>__createdAt</languageKeyword>: system created to track the creation of the record.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>__createdAt</languageKeyword>: system created to track the creation of the record.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>__updatedAt</languageKeyword>: sssystem created to track the last update to the record.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>__updatedAt</languageKeyword>: sssystem created to track the last update to the record.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>__deleted</languageKeyword>: system created to support soft delete.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>__deleted</languageKeyword>: system created to support soft delete.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the request headers.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the request headers.

trans-unit.source: The application key of the mobile service.
trans-unit.target: The application key of the mobile service.

trans-unit.source: You must specify a valid application key when required to access the table operation.
trans-unit.target: You must specify a valid application key when required to access the table operation.

trans-unit.source: This is the default table operation access permission.
trans-unit.target: This is the default table operation access permission.

trans-unit.source: The service-generated authentication token for an authenticated user.
trans-unit.target: The service-generated authentication token for an authenticated user.

trans-unit.source: You must specify a token for an authenticated user when required to access the table operation.
trans-unit.target: You must specify a token for an authenticated user when required to access the table operation.

trans-unit.source: You should only include this key when administrator access is required to access the table operation.
trans-unit.target: You should only include this key when administrator access is required to access the table operation.

trans-unit.source: The service master key is a critical security credential that provides administrator access to your data service.
trans-unit.target: The service master key is a critical security credential that provides administrator access to your data service.

trans-unit.source: Do not share this secret with anyone or distribute it with your app.
trans-unit.target: Do not share this secret with anyone or distribute it with your app.

trans-unit.source: This key must always be securely distributed over an encrypted channel.
trans-unit.target: This key must always be securely distributed over an encrypted channel.

trans-unit.source: The response includes an HTTP status code, a set of response headers, and a response body.
trans-unit.target: The response includes an HTTP status code, a set of response headers, and a response body.

trans-unit.source: A successfully operation returns status code 200 (OK).
trans-unit.target: A successfully operation returns status code 200 (OK).

trans-unit.source: The response for this operation includes the following headers.
trans-unit.target: The response for this operation includes the following headers.

trans-unit.source: The response may also include additional standard HTTP headers.
trans-unit.target: The response may also include additional standard HTTP headers.

trans-unit.source: All standard headers conform to the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=150478</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: All standard headers conform to the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=150478</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The length of the response body.
trans-unit.target: The length of the response body.

trans-unit.source: Indicates which version of the runtime executed the request.
trans-unit.target: Indicates which version of the runtime executed the request.

trans-unit.source: The JSON representation of the query result.
trans-unit.target: The JSON representation of the query result.

trans-unit.source: Results are represented as a single JSON object or a collection of JSON objects.
trans-unit.target: Results are represented as a single JSON object or a collection of JSON objects.

trans-unit.source: When you include the <parameterReference>$inlinecount</parameterReference> parameter in your query, the JSON in the response is wrapped by a new JSON object with a <languageKeyword>results</languageKeyword> property, which includes the results data as a collection of JSON objects, and a <languageKeyword>count</languageKeyword> property, which is the total count.
trans-unit.target: When you include the <parameterReference>$inlinecount</parameterReference> parameter in your query, the JSON in the response is wrapped by a new JSON object with a <languageKeyword>results</languageKeyword> property, which includes the results data as a collection of JSON objects, and a <languageKeyword>count</languageKeyword> property, which is the total count.

trans-unit.source: Authorization depends on the access permission requirements for the table operation, which are summarized as follows:
trans-unit.target: Authorization depends on the access permission requirements for the table operation, which are summarized as follows:

trans-unit.source: Access permissions for individual table operations are set in the Windows Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: Access permissions for individual table operations are set in the Windows Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: The following example URI returns JSON objects from the TodoItem table, where the complete <languageKeyword>property</languageKeyword> is <codeInline>false</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: The following example URI returns JSON objects from the TodoItem table, where the complete <languageKeyword>property</languageKeyword> is <codeInline>false</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: The request is sent with the following headers.
trans-unit.target: The request is sent with the following headers.

trans-unit.source: After the request has been sent, the following response is returned.
trans-unit.target: After the request has been sent, the following response is returned.

trans-unit.source: Filtered query request that includes total count
trans-unit.target: Filtered query request that includes total count

trans-unit.source: The following example URI returns the same filtered query, including the total count value, which in this case is 3.
trans-unit.target: The following example URI returns the same filtered query, including the total count value, which in this case is 3.

trans-unit.source: The request is sent with the following headers.
trans-unit.target: The request is sent with the following headers.

trans-unit.source: After the request has been sent, the following response is returned.
trans-unit.target: After the request has been sent, the following response is returned.
